description: participant ID generated by qualtrics and used to merge qualtrics and pavlovia data
item ID consisting of the implied label and a number (which in this context is uninformative)
order in which the behavior and reason statements were presented in the probe recognition task
coding/range:
rb = first reason, then behavior
br = first behavior, then reason

description: the type of the presented reason (sufficient reason versus control reason)
coding/range:
suff = sufficient reason
ctrl = control reason

description: the label probe of the probe recognition trial as it was presented in the paradigm
the type of the label probe (implied versus implied-other)
the validity of the participant's response to the probe word
the raw untransformed reaction times
the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than the participant's mean reaction time plus two standard deviations have been replaced by NA
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 2500 ms seconds have been replaced by NA
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 2000 ms seconds have been replaced by NA
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 1500 ms seconds have been replaced by NA
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but the reaction times have been log transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than the participant's mean reaction time plus two standard deviations have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been log transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 2500 ms seconds have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been log transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 2000 ms seconds have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been log transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 1500 ms seconds have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been log transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but the reaction times have been inverse transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than the participant's mean reaction time plus two standard deviations have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been inverse transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 2500 ms seconds have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been inverse transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 2000 ms seconds have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been inverse transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: the same as rt_none_none but all reaction times slower than 1500 ms seconds have been replaced by NA and the reaction times have been inverse transformed
derivation: derived from rt_none_none by application of cutoff and transformation

description: ratings of the label probes regarding their baserate (i.e. how likely it is for the label to apply to a stranger; for exact instructions in German language see Gitlab/stimuli/ratings.xlsx)
coding/range:
1 = sehr gering (very low)
2 = eher gering (rather low)
3 = mittel (medium)
4 = eher hoch (rather high)
5 = sehr hoch (very high)

description: ratings of the label probes regarding how much participants identified with them (for exact instructions in German language see Gitlab/stimuli/ratings.xlsx)
coding/range:
1 = gar nicht (not at all)
2 = eher schwach (rather weakly)
3 = teilweise (partially)
4 = eher stark (rather strongly)
5 = sehr stark (very strongly)

description: ratings of the label probes with regards to whether they are necessary to explain the behavior they were implied by (for exact instructions in German language see Gitlab/stimuli/ratings.xlsx)
coding/range:
1 = nein (no)
2 = eher nein (rather no)
3 = teilweise (partially)
4 = eher ja (rather yes)
5 = ja (yes)

description: ratings of the reasons with regards to whether they sufficiently explain the behavior they were presented with (for exact instructions in German language see Gitlab/stimuli/ratings.xlsx)
coding/range:
1 = nein (no)
2 = eher nein (rather no)
3 = teilweise (partially)
4 = eher ja (rather yes)
5 = ja (yes)

description: participant age
participant gender
coding/range:
male = male
female = female
other = other

description: participants' political interest measured with a one-item scale (Zentralarchiv für empirische Sozialforschung (ZA) & Zentrum für Umfragen, Methoden und Analysen (ZUMA) e.V., 2014)
coding/range:
1 = überhaupt nicht (not at all)
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
10 = sehr stark (very strongly)

description: participants' political orientation measured with the one-item Left-Right Self-Placement scale (Breyer, 2015)
participants' satisfaction with the German political system measured with 4-item German Satisfaction with the Political System Short Scale (SPS; Dentler, Bluemke, & Gabriel, 2020)
derivation: arithmetic mean of the four item scores (not included in this dataset)

description: the behavioral description displayed before the respective probe recognition trial
proportion of participants of a pretest who deliberatively inferred the label probe or a synonymous label from the behavioral description
proportion of participants of a pretest who deliberatively inferred the label probe or a strongly associated but not necessarily synonymous label from the behavioral description
mean rating of how well the label probe could explain the behavior given by participants of a pretest
coding/range: from -2 = sehr schlecht (very badly) to 2 = sehr gut (very well)

description: difference of the reason_score between the sufficient reason and the respective control reason
coding/range: from -4 (control reason better explains the behavior) to 4 (sufficient reason better explains the behavior)
derivation: score of control reason substracted from the score of sufficient reason

description: the reason description displayed before the respective probe recognition trial
mean rating of how whether the reason could sufficiently explain the behavior given by participants of a pretest
